channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Two blocked drains opposite Harvesters Barn, 27th October
item.description:
There are two drains which are blocked - one is completely overgrown. There has been extensive correspondence about this chronic problem which will continue to be a problem until the build up of silt on the road is cleared. Simply clearing the grill does nothing to resolve the issue; the longer term efficient solution is to clear the road of mud and silt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Our kerb outside our house 20 dunster road has dropped alot since a recent repair and is dangerous., 27th October
item.description:
Kurb and surrounding area dropped atleast 3 inches since q rwcent repair wkrhin the last 10 weeks. Dangerous hazard only getting worse!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Dunster Road, Fiddler's Green, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree intruding into my garden and obscuring the street light, 27th October
item.description:
The tree on the public path is weakening my garden wall and also obscuring the street light I have lived in my house over 20 years and to my knowledge the tree has never been trimmed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Purcell Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Butts Lane, pothole at side of hump in road, 27th October
item.description:

item.title: Butts Lane, 2 potholes next to each other, 27th October
item.description:
What3words casual.rooms.starts. Other potholes are nearby. This stretch of the lane is so potted it is more farm track than highway. These potholes are patched every few months but heavy rain washes the tarmac away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Butt's Lane, Tewkesbury

item.title: Ongoing rubbish problem, 27th October
item.description:
These have been here months. They (rightly) won't be emptied as they aren't sorted and full of rubbish. 14 Granville Street, again. One item in one of the boxes is a roadworks sign. This will keep happening unless residents are spoken to by someone official. The same story at number 1 Granville Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Granville Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large potholes with loose debris, 27th October
item.description:
The potholes stretch along Unwin road by the side of number 7 Firgrove walk and the other side of Firgrove walk by number 8. Outside 1 & 3 Unwin road, The holes are growing on a daily basis and there is now a lot of loose stone everytime a vehicle drives over it. This is damaging parked cars
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Unwin Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
